intro: Digastrium baileyi, commonly known as the Bailey's digastrium, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically ovate with prominent veins and a rough texture. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
